meanings.definition: Showing a lack of good sense or judgment; foolish or stupid.
meanings.sent1: She made the silliest mistake by wearing mismatched shoes.
meanings.sent2: The silliest thing I did today was forget my lunch at home.
meanings.sent3: It was the silliest sight to see a cat trying to catch its own tail.
meanings.sent4: His decision to jump into the pool with his clothes on was the silliest move of the day.
meanings.sent5: The silliest clown at the circus made everyone laugh with his funny tricks.

meanings.sent1: The silliest argument broke out over who ate the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: I know it's the silliest question, but do you prefer cats or dogs?
meanings.sent3: The silliest part of the movie was when the characters started dancing in the rain for no reason.
meanings.sent4: Her worries about the tiny scratch on her phone seemed like the silliest concern in the world.
meanings.sent5: The silliest game they played involved balancing spoons on their noses.
